title: Gifts from the Earth: Gemstone Remedies in Homeopathy
description: Natural gemstones are sought after for their beauty and the mysterious energy we feel in their presence. So much has already been written about the use of gemstones in meditation and healing. This book explores a completely different way of looking at precious gems: through the homeopathic process, the vibrational energy of gemstones becomes amplified, so that the resulting remedies can be used as powerful healing tools. This work is the result of six years of exploration and clinical practice. The homeopath's notes and case studies offer an overview of the healing potential of twelve gemstone remedies, some of which have only recently been added to the homeopathic Materia Medica.

INTRODUCTION Gemstones have always been appreciated, coveted and desired by mankind. Yet they have no practical purpose and it was only in recent times that stones like diamonds, rubies and pearls were employed in industry for purposes other than their beauty. But the symbolism of gemstones is something we find in all cultures. Gemstones figure in religious rituals and rituals of power; religion and power are two of the big themes in gemstone remedies. Gemstones and medicine The idea that gemstones may have healing powers is not new; they have a long history of being used in folk medicine. Ayurvedic medicine has used gemstones for various medical conditions both externally, by placing the gem on the affected part of the body, and internally, by ingesting the triturated gem mixed with drink or food. European medical texts from the Middle Ages mention various gemstones for their healing properties. Hildegard von Bingen, mystic and Benedictine abbess (1098-1179), noted the medicinal properties of gemstones in her book Physica.
